column4: hey, does anyone know where ubuntu/gnome puts its xorg.conf so i can try and fix my x not starting problem?
Hold SHIFT at your PC's startup,, then select the recovery mode and go to the root console
i've restarted it holding shift, found the grub bootloader, tried to start both of the kernels installed (24 and 26) in recovery mode
but both of them black screen after they get to a certain stage on boot
i can ssh to the machine fine, but i'm not getting any output on the monitor at all
So did you wait a while or try CTRL+ALT+F1 and F7
i've been mashing various keyboard combinations without success for the last 20 minutes :)
obviously that's not all i've been doing, but :P
just tried it again, and no response :(
I think i've narrowed down the issue by looking at the log files to -something- to do with the kernel update ubuntu installed not playing nicely with the version of the nouveau drivers its using
but i need to see an xorg.conf to fix that, and i can't find an xorg.conf on any of the disk
That's why you need dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
